channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Water-pocalyse in parts of Asia: Why are floods that claimed 1,000 lives so deadly?
Cyclone Ditwah: Inside India’s Operation Sagar Bandhu to aid flood-ravaged Sri Lanka
Who will replace Jerome Powell as US Fed Chair as Trump nears his final choice?
Why is Elon Musk and his ‘half-Indian’ partner Shivon Zilis’ son’s middle name Sekhar
Why has Israeli PM Netanyahu sought a presidential pardon? What happens next?
Stockton mass shooting: How a child’s birthday party turned into a deadly tragedy
Pakistan’s nightmare: How Chabahar is becoming India’s strategic bridge to Afghanistan
item.description: Afghanistan is no longer willing to live in Pakistan’s shadow, and India’s years of investment in Iran’s Chabahar port are finally paying off

item.title: Munir’s iron grip, Khan’s death rumours push Pakistan towards a dangerous juncture
item.description: Imran Khan has repeatedly accused General Asim Munir of being the ‘most oppressive dictator’ in the country’s history and of orchestrating a vindictive political crackdown. Rumours about Khan’s death have further deepened Pakistan’s political polarisation, pushing the country to a critical juncture

item.title: What Putin’s visit next week means for India-Russia ties in a turbulent world
item.description: Being a proud country with dignity, Russia needs and wants India to counter hegemony from both the East and the West

item.title: How Pakistan’s ‘strategic depth’ on terrorism turned into a ‘strategic trap’
item.description: Provinces once celebrated as Pakistan’s ‘strategic depth’ — Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan — are now insurgency belts where the state loses soldiers faster than it can rotate reinforcements

item.title: Thanesar: In Kurukshetra’s shadow, a tale of ruins, history and faith
item.description: If someone happens to visit Kurukshetra for the Gita Mahotsav, he must drop in to the archaeological complex at Thanesar to relive its history

item.title: India’s quiet strategy for turbulent times: Bide the time, build the strength
item.description: For the idea of Atmanirbhar Bharat to help make India a superpower, India has to manufacture things that are big and small, on its own steam, with original thinking
